comment: The greatest common divisor of six and four is two. To calculate this gcd, a simple form of Euclid's algorithm is used: ` ( 6 gcd 4 ) = ( ( 4 + 2 ) gcd 4 ) = ( 2 gcd 4 ) ` and ` ( 2 gcd 4 ) = ( 2 gcd ( 2 + 2 ) ) = ( 2 gcd 2 ) = 2 ` . (Contributed by AV, 27-Aug-2020.)
